data.question: What is the main pollutant discussed in the study?
What is the name of the redox-active MOF used for NO2 adsorption?
What happens to NO2 when adsorbed by MFM-300(V)?
data.answer: NO2 is reduced to NO and water is released.

data.question: Is the NO2 uptake in MFM-300(V) reversible?
What is the NO2 uptake capacity of MFM-300(V) at 298 K and 1.0 bar?
Does MFM-300(V) undergo structural changes upon NO2 adsorption?
data.answer: Yes, it undergoes oxidation from V(III) to V(IV).

data.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the change in oxidation state of V in MFM-300(V)?
Can MFM-300(V) adsorb NO2 at ppm-level concentrations?
What is the role of the bridging hydroxyl groups in MFM-300(V) during NO2 adsorption?
data.answer: They are deprotonated to accommodate oxidation of the V centers.

data.question: Is the adsorption of NO2 in MFM-300(V) accompanied by the formation of N2O4 dimers?
What is the BET surface area of MFM-300(V)?
Does MFM-300(V) show higher NO2 uptake compared to MFM-520(Zn)?
What is the pore volume of MFM-300(V) obtained from CO2 adsorption data?
What is the significance of the breakthrough experiments with NO?
data.answer: They confirm the low dynamic adsorption of NO by MFM-300(V).

data.question: Is the adsorption of NO2 in MFM-300(V) chemically inert?
What is the crystal structure model used for MFM-300(V) after NO2 adsorption?
What is the role of supramolecular interactions in NO2 adsorption within MFM-300(V)?
data.answer: They stabilize the adsorbed NO2 and N2O4 molecules.

data.question: Does the adsorption of NO2 in MFM-300(V) lead to a color change?
What is the role of the vanadium centers in MFM-300(V) during NO2 adsorption?
data.answer: They undergo oxidation from V(III) to V(IV).

data.question: Is the adsorption capacity of MFM-300(V) for NO2 higher than that of activated carbons?
